intro: Pholidota triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed pholidota, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three distinct lobes. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pink or purple and are arranged in clusters. Pholidota triloba is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
